subtasks.details:
Install Voltagent via npm, set up environment variables (API keys, tokens), and define agent configurations in TypeScript. Each agent should have unique instructions, model/provider settings, and tool integrations as needed. Ensure agents are registered with the Voltagent instance and ready for orchestration.
<info added on 2025-10-16T00:05:05.230Z>
## Implementation Approach for Voltagent Integration

- Implement a lightweight integration pattern using Supabase Edge Functions rather than bundling a full Voltagent server
- Create TypeScript configurations for three agent profiles:
  1. Research agent
  2. Project idea generator
  3. Email outreach agent

### Technical Implementation Details
- Use AI SDK providers (Anthropic/OpenAI) directly within Edge Functions
- Configure provider selection via environment variables
- Define shared prompt templates and output schemas for each agent type
- Implement standardized client-server contract:
  - Endpoints accept JSON payloads
  - Respond via Server-Sent Events (SSE) with standardized event types:
    - progress: execution status updates
    - chunk: incremental response data
    - error: failure information
    - done: completion signal

### Database Schema Extensions
- Add tables for agent operations:
  - voltagent_executions: log all agent runs with inputs/outputs
  - voltagent_cache: store responses with 24-hour TTL
  - rate_limits: implement token bucket algorithm for API quota management

### Next Implementation Steps
- Scaffold Edge Functions directory structure
- Create shared utility modules for agent operations
- Prepare .env example with required provider API keys
</info added on 2025-10-16T00:05:05.230Z>

tasks.title: Scaffold VoltAgent Server with Observability (Pre-Agent Implementation)
tasks.description: Set up a minimal VoltAgent server package focused on observability, integrating VoltOps monitoring and preparing environment/configuration for future agent migrations.
tasks.details:
1. Create a new Node.js package (e.g., /packages/voltagent-server) using Hono as the HTTP server framework and install @voltagent/core and @voltagent/server-hono (or equivalent adapter).
2. Implement a minimal VoltAgent server that enables VoltAgentObservability (in-memory by default) and exposes a local WebSocket endpoint for real-time monitoring. Do not migrate any business logic or agent implementations yetSupabase Edge Functions and UI remain unchanged.
3. Use the existing MCP server integration in Warp to fetch and document VoltAgent observability docs (observability/overview.md, observability/developer-console.md, agents/overview.md) via MCP tools (list_voltagent_docs, get_voltagent_doc). Summarize expected environment variables, keys, and ports required by VoltOps in README/WARP notes.
4. Add VOLTAGENT_PUBLIC_KEY and VOLTAGENT_SECRET_KEY to .env.example, with documentation on how to obtain and configure these for VoltOps export. Note that persistence (e.g., LibSQL) is not required now, but mention @voltagent/libsql adapter for future reference.
5. Add a package.json script "voltagent:dev" to start the server locally (default http://localhost:3141). Provide a dev script and clear instructions in README/WARP notes for running the server, opening the VoltOps console (https://console.voltagent.dev), and verifying the connection.
6. Clearly document that all business logic and agent migrations will be handled in future per-agent tasks (research, project-generator, email-outreach) after stabilization. Include explicit notes to keep Supabase Edge Functions and UI as-is for now.
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Run 'npm run voltagent:dev' and verify the VoltAgent server starts at http://localhost:3141 with observability enabled (check for startup logs and WebSocket endpoint).
2. Confirm @voltagent/core and @voltagent/server-hono (or equivalent) are installed and imported correctly.
3. Check that VOLTAGENT_PUBLIC_KEY and VOLTAGENT_SECRET_KEY are present in .env.example and referenced in server code; verify documentation for obtaining/configuring these keys is clear.
4. Use MCP tools to fetch and display observability documentation; ensure README/WARP notes include summarized steps and expected configuration.
5. Open https://console.voltagent.dev and verify the local server is visible and real-time monitoring is functional (WebSocket view).
6. Ensure README/WARP notes specify that Supabase Edge Functions and UI remain unchanged, and that future agent migrations are planned as follow-up tasks.
